thread.title: Burien Nursing and Rehab will Host Screening of Stu Maddux Film, Reel in the Closet

author: cbs8
title: Burien Nursing and Rehab will Host Screening of Stu Maddux Film, Reel in the Closet
text:
First time screening of Reel in the Closet, a documentary, to be shown at Burien Nursing and Rehab
Burien, WA (PRWEB) October 07, 2015
In light of LGBT month, Burien Nursing and Rehabilitation Center will be holding a screening of Stu Maddux’s new film, Reel in the Closet, a documentary highlighting stories about the LGBTQ community that takes viewers as far back as 1939.
In the past, Burien Rehab held a screening for one of Stu Maddux’s other films entitled Gen Silent, which featured stories about gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender people from an older generation who faced considerable amounts of fear of bullying and abuse.
“Gen Silent was such an impactful film that we are providing a financial sponsorship for his next project, which is being screened in Seattle on October 14, 2015, at the Northwest Film Forum,” said Nichole Casado, Director of Community Relations at the facility. “And we will have a presence at the screening.”
This event will take place on October 27, 2015, at 6:30 p.m. at the Burien Rehab facility. The event is free for anyone who wants to come, but seating is limited. Please contact Nichole Casado at admissions(at)burienrehab(dot)com to RSVP.
About Stu Maddux
Stu Maddux is a multi-award-winning filmmaker with international credits whose many goals include strengthening the queer community by bringing together its different generations. You can read more about him and his work here .
About Burien Nursing and Rehabilitation Center
Burien Nursing and Rehabilitation Center has been recognized as one of America's 2015 Best Nursing Homes by U.S. News & World Report and currently holds a five-star rating. Burien is a skilled nursing facility located in Burien, WA that provides 24-hour skilled care and rehabilitation services in a comfortable and friendly environment.
 //www.prweb.com/releases/2015/10/prweb13000824.htm
